author: Staff Reporter
text:
Owners demand charges agreed upon in the agreement

Owners of about 30,000 power loom job working units in Tirupur, Avinashi, Palladam and nearby areas commenced an indefinite strike on Thursday.

Job work charges

They downed the shutters stating that job work charges were not given at the increased slabs by the textile units for the production of fabrics.

About 1.2 crore metres of fabrics were produced by these units collectively on a day.

Pact

“As per the three-year agreement signed on 2014, the textile units should have given a 27 per cent hike on the job work charges from the then prevailed rates. Though they gave the increased rates for the first few months, the promises were not fulfilled since then.

Most of the time, the charges have been given at the older slabs,” pointed out R. Velusamy, president of Tirupur District Job Work Powerloom Weavers Association.

Mr. Velusamy added that though the Collector and the MLA of Palladam constituency had requested the unit owners to review the decision to strike, the unit owners decided otherwise.

The unit owners pointed out that they would not reverse the decision to strike till the job work charges were disbursed at the rates agreed upon in the pact.
title: Power loom job working units begin strike
